verses.kjv: And certain men which came down from Judaea taught the brethren, and said, Except ye be circumcised after the manner of Moses, ye cannot be saved.
verses.ct: Some men came down from Judaea and started teaching the brothers, "Unless you get circumcised according to the practice established by Moses, you can't be saved."

verses.kjv: When therefore Paul and Barnabas had no small dissension and disputation with them, they determined that Paul and Barnabas, and certain other of them, should go up to Jerusalem unto the apostles and elders about this question.
verses.ct: This led to a serious argument and debate between Paul and Barnabas and these men. So it was decided that Paul, Barnabas, and some others from the group should travel up to Jerusalem to discuss this issue with the apostles and elders.

verses.kjv: And being brought on their way by the church, they passed through Phenice and Samaria, declaring the conversion of the Gentiles: and they caused great joy unto all the brethren.
verses.ct: The church sent them on their way, and as they traveled through Phenice and Samaria, they shared the news about how non-Jewish people were turning to God. This brought tremendous joy to all the brothers.

verses.kjv: And when they were come to Jerusalem, they were received of the church, and of the apostles and elders, and they declared all things that God had done with them.
verses.ct: When they arrived in Jerusalem, the church, the apostles, and the elders welcomed them, and they reported everything God had accomplished through them.

verses.kjv: But there rose up certain of the sect of the Pharisees which believed, saying, That it was needful to circumcise them, and to command them to keep the law of Moses.
verses.ct: But some believers who belonged to the Pharisee party stood up and insisted, "These Gentile converts must be circumcised and required to follow the law of Moses."

verses.kjv: And the apostles and elders came together for to consider of this matter.
verses.ct: The apostles and elders gathered together to examine this issue.

verses.kjv: And when there had been much disputing, Peter rose up, and said unto them, Men and brethren, ye know how that a good while ago God made choice among us, that the Gentiles by my mouth should hear the word of the gospel, and believe.
verses.ct: After a long debate, Peter stood up and addressed them: "Brothers, you know that some time ago God chose me from among you so that the Gentiles would hear the message of the gospel from my lips and come to believe.

verses.kjv: And God, which knoweth the hearts, bare them witness, giving them the Holy Ghost, even as he did unto us;
verses.ct: God, who knows what's in every heart, confirmed his acceptance of them by giving them the Holy Spirit, just as he did for us.

verses.kjv: And put no difference between us and them, purifying their hearts by faith.
verses.ct: He made no distinction between us and them — he purified their hearts through faith.

verses.kjv: Now therefore why tempt ye God, to put a yoke upon the neck of the disciples, which neither our fathers nor we were able to bear?
verses.ct: So why are you testing God now by placing a burden on these disciples that neither our ancestors nor we have been able to carry?

verses.kjv: But we believe that through the grace of the LORD Jesus Christ we shall be saved, even as they.
verses.ct: Instead, we believe that we are saved through the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ, and so are they."

verses.kjv: Then all the multitude kept silence, and gave audience to Barnabas and Paul, declaring what miracles and wonders God had wrought among the Gentiles by them.
verses.ct: The whole assembly fell silent and listened as Barnabas and Paul described all the miraculous signs and wonders God had performed among the Gentiles through them.

verses.kjv: And after they had held their peace, James answered, saying, Men and brethren, hearken unto me:
verses.ct: When they finished speaking, James responded: "Brothers, listen to me.

verses.kjv: Simeon hath declared how God at the first did visit the Gentiles, to take out of them a people for his name.
verses.ct: Simeon has explained how God first reached out to the Gentiles to gather from among them a people for himself.

verses.kjv: And to this agree the words of the prophets; as it is written,
verses.ct: The words of the prophets agree with this, as Scripture says:

verses.kjv: After this I will return, and will build again the tabernacle of David, which is fallen down; and I will build again the ruins thereof, and I will set it up:
verses.ct: 'After this I will return and rebuild David's fallen dwelling. I will restore its ruins and raise it up again,

verses.kjv: That the residue of men might seek after the Lord, and all the Gentiles, upon whom my name is called, saith the Lord, who doeth all these things.
verses.ct: so that the rest of humanity may seek the Lord — all the Gentiles who are called by my name,' says the Lord, who does all these things.

verses.kjv: Known unto God are all his works from the beginning of the world.
verses.ct: All of God's works have been known to him since the beginning of time.

verses.kjv: Wherefore my sentence is, that we trouble not them, which from among the Gentiles are turned to God:
verses.ct: Therefore, my judgment is that we should not create obstacles for the Gentiles who are turning to God.

verses.kjv: But that we write unto them, that they abstain from pollutions of idols, and from fornication, and from things strangled, and from blood.
verses.ct: Instead, we should write to them and tell them to stay away from food contaminated by idols, from sexual immorality, from meat of strangled animals, and from consuming blood.

verses.kjv: For Moses of old time hath in every city them that preach him, being read in the synagogues every sabbath day.
verses.ct: After all, Moses has been proclaimed in every city for generations, since his writings are read aloud in the synagogues every Sabbath."

verses.kjv: Then pleased it the apostles and elders, with the whole church, to send chosen men of their own company to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas; namely, Judas surnamed Barsabas, and Silas, chief men among the brethren:
verses.ct: Then the apostles, the elders, and the entire church decided to select representatives from among them and send them to Antioch along with Paul and Barnabas. They chose Judas, also called Barsabas, and Silas — both respected leaders among the brothers.

verses.kjv: And they wrote letters by them after this manner; The apostles and elders and brethren send greeting unto the brethren which are of the Gentiles in Antioch and Syria and Cilicia:
verses.ct: They sent the following letter with them: "From the apostles, elders, and brothers — greetings to the Gentile brothers in Antioch, Syria, and Cilicia.

verses.kjv: Forasmuch as we have heard, that certain which went out from us have troubled you with words, subverting your souls, saying, Ye must be circumcised, and keep the law: to whom we gave no such commandment:
verses.ct: We have heard that some people who came from our group disturbed you and unsettled your souls with their teaching that you must be circumcised and obey the law — even though we never authorized them to say that.

verses.kjv: It seemed good unto us, being assembled with one accord, to send chosen men unto you with our beloved Barnabas and Paul,
verses.ct: So we unanimously agreed to choose representatives and send them to you along with our dear friends Barnabas and Paul,

verses.kjv: Men that have hazarded their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.ct: who have risked their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.kjv: We have sent therefore Judas and Silas, who shall also tell you the same things by mouth.
verses.ct: We are therefore sending Judas and Silas, who will confirm this same message in person.

verses.kjv: For it seemed good to the Holy Ghost, and to us, to lay upon you no greater burden than these necessary things;
verses.ct: It seemed right to the Holy Spirit and to us not to place any heavier burden on you than these essential requirements:

verses.kjv: That ye abstain from meats offered to idols, and from blood, and from things strangled, and from fornication: from which if ye keep yourselves, ye shall do well. Fare ye well.
verses.ct: Stay away from food sacrificed to idols, from blood, from the meat of strangled animals, and from sexual immorality. If you keep yourselves from these things, you will do well. Goodbye."

verses.kjv: So when they were dismissed, they came to Antioch: and when they had gathered the multitude together, they delivered the epistle:
verses.ct: So the men were sent off and went down to Antioch, where they called the whole community together and delivered the letter.

verses.kjv: Which when they had read, they rejoiced for the consolation.
verses.ct: When the people read it, they were overjoyed at the encouragement it brought.

verses.kjv: And Judas and Silas, being prophets also themselves, exhorted the brethren with many words, and confirmed them.
verses.ct: Judas and Silas, who were also prophets, spoke at length to encourage and strengthen the brothers.

verses.kjv: And after they had tarried there a space, they were let go in peace from the brethren unto the apostles.
verses.ct: After spending some time there, the brothers sent them off in peace to return to those who had sent them.

verses.kjv: Notwithstanding it pleased Silas to abide there still.
verses.ct: However, Silas decided to remain there.

verses.kjv: Paul also and Barnabas continued in Antioch, teaching and preaching the word of the Lord, with many others also.
verses.ct: Paul and Barnabas also stayed in Antioch, where they taught and proclaimed the word of the Lord alongside many others.

verses.kjv: And some days after Paul said unto Barnabas, Let us go again and visit our brethren in every city where we have preached the word of the LORD, and see how they do.
verses.ct: After some time, Paul said to Barnabas, "Let's go back and visit the brothers in every city where we proclaimed the word of the LORD, and see how they're doing."

verses.kjv: And Barnabas determined to take with them John, whose surname was Mark.
verses.ct: Barnabas wanted to bring along John, who was also called Mark.

verses.kjv: But Paul thought not good to take him with them, who departed from them from Pamphylia, and went not with them to the work.
verses.ct: But Paul didn't think it was wise to take him, since Mark had abandoned them in Pamphylia and hadn't continued with them in the work.

verses.kjv: And the contention was so sharp between them, that they departed asunder one from the other: and so Barnabas took Mark, and sailed unto Cyprus;
verses.ct: Their disagreement became so intense that they parted ways. Barnabas took Mark and sailed for Cyprus,

verses.kjv: And Paul chose Silas, and departed, being recommended by the brethren unto the grace of God.
verses.ct: while Paul chose Silas and left, entrusted by the brothers to the grace of God.

verses.kjv: And he went through Syria and Cilicia, confirming the churches.
verses.ct: He traveled through Syria and Cilicia, strengthening the churches.
